Reviews.Title: “Budget-Freindly”
Reviews.Author: lacottrelll
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. The location is nice if you are visiting Seaworld and they offer free quick queue passes to their guests. I visited the hotel for spring break on March 18-22, 2012 with my family. The free breakfast is good but not great. You do have the option to eat next door at the adjoining hotel for free. The gym was small but had what i needed. The pool area was also on the small side but the kids did enjoy it. Our room size was more than adequate and I have no complaints abou the beds. I would consider this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tara L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from March 21-28 for our Orlando vacation. We usually stay at Disney so we were a bit nervous to try something new. I was very happy with this hotel. It was clean and modern, the staff were friendly. So close to seaworld you can see it from the front of the hotel. Great shuttle to seaworld and aquatica. Wonderful pool area that serves pizza hut food at the pool bar with very reasonable prices. We had a fridge in our room that we filled with water and soft drinks for the week to save some money. The hotel has a 24hr cvs pharmacy next door that was great for picking up snacks. I would say this hotel cant be beat for the value. One small drawback is that there is only 1 shuttle to Universal at 10am that comes back at 7:25pm so you have to plan your day around it but it worked out well for us. Free wifi also a bonus. Very decent free breakfast daily but it closes at 9:30am so no sleeping in if you want to use this service.

Reviews.Title: “New Addition to Sea World Lodging Choices”
Reviews.Author: RelaisAndChateau
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel adjacent to Sea World Orlando. Nice accomodations plus a CVS and TGIF's across the parking lot. Splash pool with bar/food avialable. Good for business or family.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: PeterW99
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to this hotel. It is nice to return and find that standards have not dropped. The hotel is one of the cleanest that we have stayed in. Not having a car has not been an inconvienience. The I Trolley stops outside and runs the length of International Drive every twenty minutes (stop 35). There is a CVS, TK Friday, Denny's, Wendys, McDonalds all outside. Just past McDonalds there is also a Publix supermarket where you can buy anything you have run out of at reasonable prices. The hotel also offers a good, but basic complementary buffet breakfast and has Wi fi access in rooms, along with complementary computers in public areas. All in all this hotel is hard to beat if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - They need to be encouraged to stop the styrofoam use!”
Reviews.Author: Holly S
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic experience here. When I first came I actually booked the hotel wrong and they were not expecting me, they didn't even blink an eye. They used what information I had and welcomed me using the same great price I originally booked the hotel for! Fantastic customer service. Hotel was really nice and updated, staff was beyond friendly and the pool and room were very nice. Fantastic value and I highly recommend! However, when I walked into their wonderful breakfast I was stunned at all of the styrofoam being used. I couldn't even feel good about eating breakfast anymore! I encouraged our family to share plates, cups and bowls to limit out impact on the environment but to no avail, it was impossible to eat without using some. PLEASE FAIRFIELD INN - BUY DISHES AND A DISHWASHER OR USE BIODEGRADABLE PRODUCTS. I would be happy to pay a small fee to offset the cost. I know styrofoam is cheap but does it have to be at the cost of being responsible?? * Readers Please Comment on my Facebook Page* http://www.facebook.com/StopStyrofoamAtFairfieldInn Please don't misunderstand me. I love the hotel and you should stay here, I just think we should all try to encourage them to make the correct environmental choices.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: tjmel4
Reviews.Content: Great location for Seaworld, Discovery Cove, etc. Room was spotless, staff couldn't have been more friendly, nice and quiet. Only (minor) complaints were the size of the room (seemed a little small for a suite) and the complimentary breakfast was kind of limited (breakfast at the attached Spring Hill suites was a little better, though).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Confusedsquirrel
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the USA, and we were so glad to have stayed at this hotel. This is going to be a long review... THE ROOM The room was lovely. Very well maintained, everything in good condition (as it is a relatively new hotel), spacious and welcoming. We had two queen beds - and that was booked as a standard room so we were extremely happy with this. Nice size TV with plenty of channels - they even had the Manchester United game on which kept my partner happy. Lots of storage space for clothes and suitcases. Microwave and fridge in room which was handy for when we were too worn out by the end of the day to face the public at dinner time. Air conditioning worked well. Hairdryer, ironing board and iron all included in room - very glad I didn't bring my hairdyer along as this one did a decent job. Nice, clean bathroom with powerful shower and regular bath. BIG mirror. THE STAFF The front desk, housekeeping and maintenance staff were all so good at their jobs and nothing was too much. They were all so cheerful and very helpful. Not much else to say about them really! HOTEL FEATURES The pool is a reasonable size and well maintained. There are plenty of sunloungers and pool towels always available. As there is so much to do in Orlando we only went to the pool once during our two weeks. There is a bar in the pool area which has nice food. There is also a jacuzzi which is just bliss at the end of the day - and it is open until 11pm. The hotel is interlinked with the Springhill Suites next door (you have to walk through the pool area to get to it which takes less than a minute). This is where the 'gym' is located. The 'gym' consists of a selection of weights and some cardio machines - no floor space or resistance machines for a proper work-out but enough to keep you active during your stay. The Springhill also houses a coffee bar which serves Starbucks beverages throughout the morning. It is also where you will find the computers for free internet access and the Expedia Local Expert desk. This was probably the most useful thing to us on our holiday as they know everything about what to do in Orlando. Michael Brugnone ran the desk on most days and he was extremely knowledgable. He helped us arrange tickets to see an Orlando Magic game (which I highly recommend) and, as it is a Seaworld hotel, he arranged our FREE QuickQueue tickets for the rides at Seaworld - along with many other things. He is a very helpful man indeed. While at this desk you may end up chatting to someone from the Marriott Vacation Club. This is all about getting involved in a timeshare thing. They take you to the local vacation club, show you around the apartments, offer you deals and try to convince you to get involved. When it's all over (approximately 2 hours) and you've managed to convince them you don't want to get involved, you get a $100 gift card to take off your hotel bill! This was handy as we had ordered room service from the pool bar, TGI Friday's (which is nextdoor to the hotel) and I had used the dry cleaning service. Then we used the remainder in the hotel shop. Also, if you do not use room service they allow you to redeem it against park tickets. Not only that but the rep at the hotel will give you voucher books to spend at the outlets which also came in handy. LOCATION This hotel was in the perfect location for us. We did not hire a car so used the public transport. We bought 14-day iRide passes from our Virgin rep in advance, but you can get these from the Expedia desk. This got us to Seaworld, the shopping areas and a couple of water parks. There are shuttle buses from the hotel to all the other parks excluding Disney. It's a little too far to get a taxi to Disney everytime so we jumped on the Lynx 50 which cost $2 a ride. There is a Publix supermarket a 10-minute walk away. There is absolutely no need to hire a car unless you plan on going places further afield. ISSUES There were only two problems we came across on our holiday. 1) Our in-room phones stopped calling local and international numbers and we could only call the front desk. This only happened a few days before we left so we weren't too fussed. 2) There was not an in-room safe. We kept our passports locked in a safe at the front desk and every day my partner had to take his MacBook downstairs to be locked in the office which had CCTV. The UK equivalent of this hotel is a Thistle hotel. But this is even better. You don't have people running around carrying your bags for you - but the service is fantastic and we would deifinitely stay again. A perfect hotel for a perfect holiday!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for seaworld and aquatica”
Reviews.Author: 59Jill
Reviews.Content: Very impressed, modern, clean , free wireless in room (you have to re register every day but its simple), great free breakfast, good shuttles to Seaworld and aquatica (about 5 each day whilst we were there (8-20 Feb) . One shuttle to universal leaving at 10 and returning at 7.25pm which was OK. The staff were great, the TGI Fridays very close and good food and the CVS again very close and did a good range of drinks and snacks. Would stay here again if doing Seaworld/Aquatica/ Discovery Cove.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: Janesports
Reviews.Content: The reviews here are right on. This hotel is clean and modern, allows quick access to SeaWorld and will give you those Quick Queues for fast line access to the park's attractions. The pool is great for kids, with penguins in the toddler-friendly shallow end and a poolside grill. Even Starbucks coffee at the SpringHill Suites next door. The morning breakfast is fine, although a little more fresh fruit would be a great improvement. But each morning a nice selection of bread and meat and eggs. You can get discounts to the dining at the SeaWorld restaurants as well. And right across the street there is a Thai restaurant, a good sushi place, a Denny's and a TGIF. We rented a car and went to Downtown Disney one night and Universal CityWalk the other. It's very easy to get around from the Fairfield Marriott. You could pay more to stay at the nearby Renaissance or one of the better hotels in the area, but for a short trip with a lot of time at the parks, the Fairfield is easier on the wallet and you can upgrade your vacation in other ways. Plus with the deals coming from the affiliation with SeaWorld, staying at the Fairfield makes everything easier. I've been to Orlando three times in the last year, and stayed at some technically nicer hotels. But for our 4-day trip this was the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: felinfoggy
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel and it was great. The shuttle was on time to seaworld. The food at the pool side bar and grill was good. The only complant was they did not have a free shuttle to the airport. It cost us $42.00. That was an unexpected expense. But I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on room and parks”
Reviews.Author: jqpjr
Reviews.Content: We got a really good package deal through the Seaworld site which included 1 night's room and 2 14 day passes each for Sea World and Busch Gardens. Also included was 1 day of free food at each park. The price was extremely good. The hotel itself was much better than expected. The room seemed brand new and was decorated in a modern and stylish way. Very quiet. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday Great Place”
Reviews.Author: pattipickle
Reviews.Content: We changed to this hotel after not being happy with the first one (four points by sheraton, which was noisy, shabby and did not give a very professional impression). I can only say the staff were fantastic, the location is excellent and hotel itself is new, with marbled floors and nice decor. It was very comfortable, the rooms were serviced daily, the swimming pool is heated so no massive shocks when you first get in. Although the hotel is quiet at night there is plenty to do and see nearby a fab location, for all you can do in Florida whilst peaceful enough to get your rest. We had our baby (8 months ) with us and staff bent over backwards to meet all our needs for the baby. Its price is defintely value for money and it offers everything you need. The only criticism I would have and it is minor is that the breakfast is a bit similar and limited after 14 nights and to get fresh fruit there has to be a conference party in or you have to be up really early. It's ok though for a continental breakfast. If you want something they have acrossthe other side in the springhill suites the staff will get it or you can eat there as its the same hotel. We saved money moving as this hotel was slightly cheaper than the 4 points and despite paying an admin fee to move, we saved as the previous hotel was room only and as far as facilities and comfort are concerned there was no contest. Look out for Joe at breakfast he is funny and will help all he can. We would defintely go back to this hotel all in all a fab time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, good location, close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: johndfffff
Reviews.Content: This property has a nice, 24 hour exercise room, just off the pool (which is open till 11PM). The hot tub is nice also. This property adjoins it's sister property, Springhill Suites. The room was nice, small refrigerator, clean. All in all, a very nice hotel, well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Panqu W
Reviews.Content: Fairfield hotel is well worth the previous review- it is really an excellent hotel. When we check in there is no extra 2-bed room. The front desk staff really take care of the issue and help us move in the 2-bed room after 2 nights stay. We stayed in this hotel 6 nights in total as we spend the new year in Orlando, and the hotel really impressed us. Extremely clean and modern, beds are comfortable, environment is quite and warm, staff is friendly and helpful, concierge desk is reliable and efficient. Complimentary shuttle services to Sea World and Universal Studios and free breakfast(if only they can proivide meat in breakfast!). Located few minutes from Sea World and we can hear the screaming from the roller coaster while in the room and open the window(close the window is really quiet). CVS and several restaurant in walking distance(Japanese, Thai food and several fast food). Anyway, if you have any questions or requests(like replacing keys and adding comfort), just ask the front desk and they will give efficient and considerable response. In all, a five-star stay in Fairfield. Definitely will come back if possible!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, perfect position”
Reviews.Author: LaurenziaItaly
Reviews.Content: This is not a brand new hotel, but it's very clean and it has been renovated. We had a larger double room and there was plenty of space: 2 queen beds (one for my husband and me, one for our 3 years old daughter), one baby cot (for our 1 year old daughter), one sofa bed, 2 tables, flat screen tv, fridge, micro ways (very important with small kids!), closet, free wifi... Inside the hotel there are just a bar and a small shop (unfortunately no good restaurant), but few meters away, there are a pharmacy, a friday's, a delicious sushi restaurant, a thai restaurant and a denny's. The breakfast inside the hotel is ok, but not fantastic. The swimming pool is quite small and basic, but there are so many things to do in Orlando that it is difficult to find the time to spend at the pool :) The hotel position is perfect, close to the best parks and attractions. We stayed at the Fairfield 10 days and we felt like home!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, like new, and good location”
Reviews.Author: Blumagoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during Christmas week. The hotel itself was very clean and in a convenient location. Breakfast was rather standard. It was enough to get the day started. There was ample seating. My only complaint would be that there was no one at the concierge desk during our stay. We checked-in early (~11am) because of the Marriott status of a member of our group. We walked through the lobby several times throughout our stay (morning, afternoon, evening, and night) and never was there a time where someone was manning the concierge desk. Yes, we could have asked the front desk (which was legitimately busy during each of our lobby walkthroughs) and I suppose if our questions were really important or our stay was longer, we would have. But the papers on the lounge tables do advertise that discounted tickets and information on the Marriott Vacation Club can be found at the concierge desk. Not to have someone manning that desk doesn't make much sense.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location and Sparkling Clean”
Reviews.Author: FloridaRetiree2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a brief overnight trip to visit Disney World's Christmas celebrations. It is only a couple of exits from Disney on I-4 in Orlando, so close and convenient. The hotel is practically brand new - and extremely modern and clean. The front desk staff were so friendly and helpful, it was almost too extreme - but much better than the alternative. The room was spotless and sparkling - complete with a microwave and small refrigerator. Our "king size" room was not too king sized, because the bed took up most of the room - but it was only for one night. Breakfast was the least exciting thing about this hotel - basic and not too healthy - cereals, waffles, white toast and bagels. I would like to see some fruit and whole grain breads. Coffee was basic and weak - although there was a Starbucks in the adjoining Spring Hill Suites hotel (the two hotels share a pool area). Overall, a fabulous hotel, reasonably priced, and impecably clean. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “closest hotel to Sea World or Discovery Cove”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun44
Reviews.Content: stayed one night this week, as it was the one of the closest hotels to Discovery cove. Nice, clean hotel. TGI Fridays is in the same parking lot. Looked like they had a nice pool/bar area, but it was raining :( the hotel has a free shuttle to seaworld which is located maybe 3 minutes driving time? free continental breakfast with muffins, bagels, toast, make-you-own waffles, fruit, juices and milk nice hotel, would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Overall, nice.”
Reviews.Author: JORDAN G
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable. The room did have a musky smell, however I sprayed some room spray and it was taken care of. The breakfast was good, many different options. They offer a complimentary shuttle to Universal Studios which is nice. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is great. I loved the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family holiday - October 2011”
Reviews.Author: Sam H
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd familiy holiday to Orlando, we have previously stayed at Disneys All Star Music and Port Orleans French Qtr. As our plan was to visit Sea World, Universal parks, Busch Gardens and Aquatica we decided to stay on I-Drive. The transfer from the airport to hotel dropped other holiday makers off at their hotels I started to worry as some of I-drive looked tacky and a bit run down, however, as we progressed down I-drive the area improved and I was really happy when we got to the Fairfield. We found that we had been allocated a lower floor room despite e-mailing to request a higher floor. However, I mentioned my request and the room was quickly changed and we got a seaworld facing room on the 6th Floor, I found the reception staff to be friendly and efficient. The room was clean and presentable, what we saw on the website was exactly what we got. Breakfast was good, nice to have a quick bite before getting straight off to the parks, the food was average but a real money saver as it was included with the price of the room. The breakfast staff were "fantastic" really helpful and chatty with the kids, it was very much like the "Disney experience" with great customer service. Shuttle to the parks, we used this service alot, the drivers were great, they really went the extra mile, one day we boarded the bus and found that it was bound for Universal and we were going to Aquatica, we were just about to go and jump on the I-trolley when the driver insisted that we stay on and he took a detour to drop us off (only a minute or two out of his way, but very kind). We used the I-Trolley quite a bit and also the linx bus to downtown disney (only 20mins from Seaworld, so easy to get about. Pool was nice, very quiet, and the pool bar really convenient (limited Pizza hut or Springhill menu) also reasonably priced. We also had room service from the pool bar, this was a life saver after an exhausting day at the parks. Housekeeping was good, the only issue was that they kept leaving De-caff coffee and I need caffine to get me started first thing but I mentioned this to reception and was given a handful of sachets to keep me going. Conciege service at Springhill was great, very helpful, we got quick que passes for Seaworld a few times and Michael at the desk remembered my name when I went back which is a nice touch. I would definately use this hotel again, Thank you Fairfield

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, well situated and very clean”
Reviews.Author: DeeLittleHobo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel ideally located near Seaworld and Aquatica. We stayed here for my 40th in September and were given free unlimited entry into Aquatica as part of deal - there were no catches. The pool area is very pleasant with plenty of sun loungers and a hot tub. There is a bar where you can order food like pizzas and snacks. Breakfast is included at the Fairfield Inn - muffins, bagels, toast, yoghurts etc. The hotel is very clean and the housekeepers always did an excellent job cleaning our room and bathroom. All the staff we dealt with were helpful and friendly. There is the TGI Fridays just outside the hotel - literally a 3 minute walk from the front enterance and they do lovely food. There is also a CVS Pharmacy a couple of minutes walk away where you can get all your holiday essentials as well as some food and drinks. There are computers in the lobby with free internet access and a printer where you can print out your boarding passes, booking confirmations etc. I believe there is free WiFi in the guest rooms but I didn't have my laptop this time to test this. There are safety deposit boxes available at reception. We had no problems parking at this hotel and always felt safe. It is a good area, only a few minutes drive from International Drive. Seaworld and Aquatica are literally under 5 minutes drive away. A few minutes drive up the road on International Drive there is an excellent iHop where you can have a more substantial breakfast if you get fed up of the hotel freebie fare. We would definetely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingScotThommo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what we needed - a clean, friendly hotel with good sized, well equipped rooms. The i-trolley stop was only a 5 minute walk away and the free shuttles to Seaworld and Aquatica were well used! Katie was a friendly face who checked us in quickly, which was we needed after our long journey and continued to provide chat and night-time cups of tea all through the holiday. It was a bit of a pain going to the sister hotel for the concierge but Michael was worth it! That man could answer any question we threw at him - which we did on a daily basis - and he went above and beyond the call of duty to arrange Howl at the Moon (the best night out of the holiday). The free breakfast is ok if all you want is cereal, toast and bagels but don't expect anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast a big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Debra M
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly because it offered a free breakfast with our stay as we are on a tight budget. We were very disappointed. The eggs and ham were cold, and coffee terrible. I couldn't even tell what the fruit cocktail was. I thought at first it might be potatoes, then realized what it was. The fruit has completely oxidized and was a brownish color. We ate elsewhere for breakfast the next two mornings. The Waffle house served up a much better breakfast! They also only provided styrofoam plates, cups and plastic cutlery, which I though cheapened the experience. They obviously have no environmental policy, which I was very disappointed by. The pool was freezing. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Seaworld Advantage!”
Reviews.Author: Margaret W
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to visit Seaworld in Orlando, this is a great hotel to stay at. Transportation is provided to and from the park. It only took us 10 minutes to get back to our hotel. The hotel bus does stop at one other nearby hotel, but because everything is so close by, it did make the travel time too long. The hotel is very clean. Lots of lounging room in the lobby. The continental breakfast included bagels, muffins, toast,cereal, fresh cut fruit salad, sausage patty, oatmeal (homemade, NOT instant) and a waffle station. Juice and coffee. If you are going to Seaworld, get your "Quick Pass" from the travel desk. You can only get it the day before you go, or the day of. They have a limited amount, so go early. You will have to visit the information desk at Seaworld to get your unlimited quick pass ticket. We never had to wait for any of the rollercoaster rides. You would have to pay for this privilege at the park. This is free bonus for staying at this hotel. There is a TGIF and CVS walking distance from the hotel. Great location. The only thing I can say that would be negative, is that the water in the rooms had that light "sulfur" odor and taste. Bring bottled water for brushing your teeth and drinking. You can really taste it when rinsing after brushing, and it was nasty! I even used bottled water in the coffee maker. It did not stay with you after showering, thank goodness. Clean, friendly and helpful staff, great price. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for visits to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: The_Swede
Reviews.Content: Staff: Very helpful Room: Clean, modern, two queen size beds, fridge, micro wave, free Wi-Fi! Pool: Not suitable for swimming but very good splash area for kids! Food and drinks @ the pool bar Breakfast: Free. No cheese or ham for sandwiches, only jam Location: Very close to Sea World, but since the side walk is missing the last bit you canÂ´t walk. There is a free shuttle from the hotel, but not that often. We booked this hotel from the Sea World web site and got complimentary unlimited Quick Queue passes and All Day Dining Deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are visiting Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: gregbooras
Reviews.Content: This is a Marriott Hotel that is only a few years old and is a good value for the money. All the rooms have flat screen TV's and the beds and rooms are very comfortable. The hotel is located only a couple of minutes from the park and they have a Pizza Hut on site.

Reviews.Title: “Is Seaworld in the rooms?”
Reviews.Author: econotraveller41
Reviews.Content: This place was just OK. Definitely nothing spectacular and my room(s) smelled of mold or mildew. I am very cautious about saying this especially when it comes to mold, but the first room I stayed in had a definite mildew odor that got progressively stronger. The staff moved me to another room, no problem there, but after the initial fresh and clean smell, it too had the odor! To make matters worse, when they moved me to the new room, they didn't tell housekeeping so there was no clean linen that evening. The Springhill Suites directly next door, I am told, is a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place!”
Reviews.Author: bill89134
Reviews.Content: Seaworld has package options including Hilton and Marriott. Based on a recommendation we selected Fairfield Inn & Suites (Marriott). This was the best price and it turned out a perfect choice. We had 3 adults and 2 children so got 2 rooms. The supervisor at check-in upgraded one of the rooms to a suite (no extra cost) so we could have adjoining rooms. Turns out that's how they are set up - standard room next to a suite next to a standard room, etc. Anyway, rooms were excellent and newly ungraded - bathrooms/beds/ flat screen TVs - all terrific. Pool setup was perfect for the kids and the late hours pool bar was just what the doctor ordered. Free breakfast was the typical continental style - adequate. TGIFridays and Wendy's are both very close for bigger meals, but little else in the area. Free Shuttle transport to Seaworld and Aquatica was okay, but kind of a weird schedule. Make sure you check at the desk. Also make sure to get the free "Quick Queue" passes for Seaworld - will save tons of time not having to wait in line for the rides. Overall , for a Seaworld and/or Aquatica visit, Fairfield Inn is the place - great rooms and facilities, excellent staff - all at a very fair price. Marriott has done well on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: SanfordSlim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business in September 2011. I have no complaints at all. The entire property was very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were about what you would expect from a Fairfield - nothing extravagant - but all the basic necessities were met. I would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING this will be our first choice everytime”
Reviews.Author: nichola15
Reviews.Content: Was a fantastic hotel and this will be our first choice if we are lucky to be able to visit again. Check in was fast and the girl checking us in ( sorry hopeless with names :) ) was very friendly and helpful. You do need a credit card when you check in and they hold about Â£180 on it. Our room was lovely, we were on the top floor which we love. we had two double beds, with a fridge, microwave and of course a flatscreen tv. Bathrooms are gorgeous with plenty of space. each floor has a laundrey with two washers and two dryers they are $1 each to use they take quaters. i never norm do washing on hol but they did come in handy. rooms were cleaned every day, bed always made. you need to leave a tip every day as it could be someone different every day but they do a wonderful job and all deserve it. there are three lifts and never had to wait very long for one. breakfast is free and it was fine for us. toast, cereal, juice etc. the pool area is bigger than it looks and is a lovely place to chill out and relax, even tho it is shared by both hotels it was never busy. they also have pool towels you can use. The splash bar and grill was great. the food was lovely. good value for money and they even do room deliverys. TGI is in the carpark too and they do wonderful food and again good value for money. They have a CVS in the carpark too which wonderful for any bits you have forgotten, they sell everything drinks, snacks etc. There was always space to park. They have three pcs in the lobby which come in handy but we were able to get wireless internet in our room on our iphone. overall a wonderful hotel would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great Marriott stay!”
Reviews.Author: kmatos
Reviews.Content: I only stay at Marriott properties (those that I've reserached of course) and this like my many other stays was wonderful, very clean and very centrally located! Staff was super nice and friendly and we were upgraded to a King Suite pon check-in which was a pleasant surprise. Room was VERY spacious and comfortable. Would defenitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “This place works for me”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Great facility, loved the location in relation to the convention center. You are able to take the trolley for $1.25 per ride up and down international drive. The breakfast was better than expected and the rooms were very clean. An upgrade on the bed would be a nice addition however I can speak intelligently about all the beds they have there, just the one in room 2012. All in all, I would definitely come back & I thought the workout room was great too. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Would be my first choice”
Reviews.Author: MrsFeckner
Reviews.Content: Good choice to consider if visiting Aquatica or the other Seaworld parks. Only stayed one night but very convenient to any of the three Seaworld parks with free shuttle buses to get you there and back. The amenities and the quality of the room was good and the price reasonable. Breakfast is included in the price and there was a good selection too. Service was very friendly and knowledgable. A fast food restaurant and TGI Fridays close by, as well as a gas station and convenience store. If the city of Orlando would place sidewalks next to the roadway, one could safely walk to the Seaworld parks in as little as five minutes. For the smaller children there is a mini water park by the pool if they didn't get enough time at Aquatica.

Reviews.Title: “I really like this hotel and will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: marcy602004
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very clean rooms and the hotel staff is extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice for a Sea World Orlando trip”
Reviews.Author: ellwooddiesel
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent stay. Everything was so nice and the staff was exxcellent. There is a nice pool that is a big hit with the family. The hotel has free shuttle service to the SeaWorld parks, and som extra perks (check at the desk in the SpringHill next door).

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again for sure”
Reviews.Author: sat_p
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn and Suites Orlando Seaworld for 13 nights towards the end of August 2011 and had 3 rooms. On check-in, our rooms were ready but they were unable to have all rooms on the same floor. 2 rooms were together and 1 was on a different floor but this did not bother us. Check-in was easy and quick. Front desk staff were very helpful and friendly at all times. Not once did we feel that we were annoying them by asking for help or asking access to the safe behind the front desk. On entering the room for the first time we were very impressed. All looked very clean and still looked like a new hotel. Bed linen was clean and fresh. View from our room looked onto SeaWorld which was also great. In general, housekeeping was done everyday however it seemed that they came either too late (ie we arrived back at 4pm some days and the room still had not been done but was evetually done after we came back from dinner), or it was done too early (ie we wanted a lay in but housekeeping was knocking on the door at 9:30am). Housekeeping could be improved. Like I said when we originally entered the room for the first time it all looked clean but during our stay it was gradually noticed that little small things are being skipped over. By this I mean the carpets are not hoovered right up to the edges and you do notice dust gathering. Also dust under the flat screen TVs was present. The only other thing was that when you sit on the toilet you do notice grime under the sink rim. Apart from this there was no mould around the bath and the decor of the room was very good. I hope they can sort this out because these are the sorts of things that start the reviews going bad... Breakfast is free in the morning. Our family are vegetarian so we only ate serial/toast/yogurt so it was good for us. However the fact that it ends at 9:30am every day means you can't have a free breakfast and have a lay in at the same time. Staff at breakfast are very welcoming and friendly and they keep the tables clean quickly. We did not experience any long queues whether we arrived at 8am or 9:15am. We used the Guest Services in the sister hotel next door. Michael was very helpful in getting us our SeaWorld/Busch/Aquatica multi tickets and he also handed us our free Quick-Queue tickets which were good for our visit to SeaWorld. The location of the hotel is very good. Right on International Drive opposite SeaWorld's but you would need to walk or take the shuttle to the entrance to SeaWorl. Very easy by car to Florida Mall, Outlets, Wallmart, the Turnpike for Miami, SeaWorld, I4 and Universal and the MCO airport. There are plenty of eating places nearby within walking distance (however we had a hire car so never walked anywhere). Pool area was clean and welcoming. There is a small snacks bar at the pool which was good and plenty of towels to use. One of the days the pool area was closed due to refurbishment. We got 2 days notice for this and I feel this should have been noted on the Marriott web site where I booked these rooms. We were at the parks that day anyway so it did not bother us however we did hear others complaining about it in the lifts. Gym was used a couple of times which is basic but still worth going to. We did not get the sitution of many kids running around in the corridoors late at night which you normally get at most hotels. Check-out was quick and easy also and it was mentioned to us how appreciated it was that we stayed there. The hotel does not have any type of of security gate at the complex entrance like other hotels do. You can just drive in to the car park, however the hotel complex did feel safe to be in and around. The only thing we did not like was that in 3 of our rooms were left coins out and housekeeping would take them. It says in the room info booklet not to leave money out so we can't really complain. However in my room I left approx $5 coins out next to the TV (as I do not like to carry coins) and they were taken. The same time these coins were taken I also left approx $5 worth of quaters in another part of the room next to a wall and next to a Washing detergent bottle as we wanted to wash our clothes before our return. It would be obvious that those quarters were for me to use in the laundry room but these coins were also taken. These coins were gradually built up in a pile over approx 8 days before they were taken. Overall, I would stay here again over any other hotel. We have always stayed at the Marriott Village before but the constant traffic congestion around that hotel put us off this time and therefore decided to stay here. Hope you find this useful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel But ....!”
Reviews.Author: YEHYA_MAYA
Reviews.Content: Positive things: Clean, good price, very good shuttle services, nice pool, I Ride trolley stop just meters away. negative things: No Safe in room, and the most important There no walkway on both side of the street and on both direction, so u have to take a taxi or wait for the Trolley, people who like to walk have to choose another hotel on the north side of international drive after seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: dking2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights to be close to Seaworld and Aquatica and it had everything we wanted. Hotel was clean and well decorated, the free breakfast was very good (and if you go early not busy) and the staff were very friendly. Special thanks to the guy from the kitchen team who made my son and daughters day giving them a free Shamu toy. One thing that was not quite as we had hoped was the shuttle service to Seaworld and Aquatica. We used this once, it ran to time but the trips were too infrequent which meant that we ended up driving and paying to park on other days.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: animallover777
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here August 12-14 for our trip to Aquatica and Discovery Cove. It is very conveniently located to both places including the parks if you are interested in going to those. Room was very nice and no complaints. The breakfast was great. Only downfall was they tell you that if you go to Seaworld you can get express pass for from from the hotel next door. This is not completely accurate. You can only use the express pass on certain days and its usually for saturdays FYI. Overall, great hotel at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luvinchris92800
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location being right across from Sea World and Aquatica. TGI Fridays and CVS in the parking lot was very convenient. Loved the pool area. The free continental breakfast was so-so but since it is free we couldn't complain. Had a bit of a problem getting used to the air conditioning but overall we had a great stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near SeaWorld, but I won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: Korgy86
Reviews.Content: It was my third annual solo trip to Orlando, and this time I was attending a pinball and video game show at the Hilton Orlando. Since the hotel is located on International Drive, I needed a hotel that was close to everything. For the most part, Fairfield Inn at SeaWorld was a good choice, but it wasn't without its flaws. Here are the pros and cons: PROS: Very clean and modern hotel with the usual bells and whistles. Opened in 2009, and is located at International Drive and CFP (Central Florida Parkway). Theme parks within driving distance, including SeaWorld and Aquatica. Guest room was very clean, the pool area was attractive (even though I decided not to go swimming), and I got to check in early. Guest room included a flat-screen TV, microwave, mini-fridge (as a tradition, I try to save money on meals), comfy bed and a spacious bathroom. Hotel staff was friendly and courteous for the most part, even though I don't remember all their names. Plenty of stores and restaurants within walking distance, including a Publix store. CONS: Have fun waiting for the I-Drive Trolley in the scorching hot Florida sun. There weren't enough trolleys that came on time, so I had to wait a while for one to arrive. The breakfast area was a zoo, and there wasn't enough variety. I basically spent the next two days having breakfast at McDonald's. The video arcade was very small, and the Family Guy pinball machine had a technical malfunction. Your room key is required to get anywhere within the hotel and the neighboring SpringHill Suites. VERY annoying. You can only get wired internet in the guest room, and the computers at the business center were slow as heck. The A/C in my room kept turning itself on every 20 minutes, but thankfully I managed to turn it off. I enjoyed my stay at Fairfield Inn at SeaWorld, but I won't be returning to this hotel. Instead, I'll stay at a hotel near Disney and Universal for next year's trip.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the bed runner”
Reviews.Author: CelticGreenEyes
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times and found it to be a good choice - good location for my business and well accommodated, especially for a Fairfield.Inn. Haven't had problems before, but this visit, as I took off the bed scarf (the decorative thing at the foot of the bed), I was totally taken aback, as it was filthy underneath. There is no way a housekeeping person could have missed that. When I told the front desk about it this morning on my way out, it was "oh, ok". I was VERY surprised as Marriott properties are usually more customer focused than that. When I said, "no it is not ok", she said, "well, I will tell housekeeping. Sorry you didn't like my answer". NOTE - Not once did she even say "Sorry that happened". I will also be providing feedback to Marriott directly. Will not be staying here again. Cleanliness trumps everything else to me, as I travel alot. If housekeeping is putting filthy bed scarves on the beds, what other corners are they cutting?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jennie2013
Reviews.Content: Everything was clean I was able to feel like I was at home. I could walk around barefooted without feeling disgusted. The room was perfect especially the bed. The bed was so comfortable that it was hard to wake up the next morning. Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great for the type of trip”
Reviews.Author: Mel6197
Reviews.Content: All in all great other than lots of hair in the pool. They need to run those filters more. Walked to cvs TGIFridays and Denny's. Sea world if we missed the bus we paid 1.25 for the trolley. Rooms were fine. Maids didn't fold extra blankets just rolled them into a ball and put them in a chair and 1 day by 4.50 still no maid. By the time she came we didn't want to leave our room so told her to forget it

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, some flaws but the staff fixed most of them.”
Reviews.Author: blamarche
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with the positives: Location is very good. Across the street to Seaworld and Aquatica. Close enough to see the fireworks each night from the pool. A few turns off the Central Parkway to I-4 and over to Disney. A right turn down International Drive to all sorts of restaurants, shows and entertainment. (Be sure to see the magic show at Wonderworks.) CVS and TGIF are right in the parking lot area. Staff is very friendly, accomdating and aims to please. The hotel and pool area are clean. Pool is shared with Springhill Suites and has a great kids splash area. They served food and drinks outside by the pool. Breakfast is complimentary. Now the negatives: First impressions mean a lot. Upon arrival we were assigned a king sized room. The room was quite small and not very accomodating for 2 adults and 2 active kids for 7 days. I went back to the front desk and asked them what had happened to my reservation for a suite with a sofa bed. They said my reservation was not for a suite, which confused me because that was the room I reconfirmed the evening before arrival. The staff changed our room, but informed me the it would cost $14.00 more per night. I was tired from driving and agreed to pay the extra. After a good nights sleep I decided to go back down to the front desk and tell them I was not going to pay the extra room rate since I knew that the room I booked was a suite and somewhere between reservations and front desk something was lost. They agreed to take off the extra for that night, but I wanted to make sure I would not be charged for the remainder of the nights either and they agreed to the original rate quoted at the reservation. They were very good about it and I was pleased by their friendly attitude. Breakfast was decent, but the hot items needed to be reheated in the microwave. It's hard to serve hot foods to dozens of guest. My biggest problem was the WiFi connection in the room. It is not truly wireless. You must plug a connecting plug into your computer and if you cannot get connected you call a toll free number and they give you instructions on how to reconfigure your pc for their wireless. BIG MISTAKE on my part. Changing my settings resulted in completly crashing my pc and upon arrival home, had to completly reset my laptop back to factory settings. It was a big mess. I should have just used the pc's they had in the business center or gone to the breakfast area where wireless seemed to be working. You also only get a 24 hour certificate and must renew this every day or you loose the connection. So if you want to surf the net in your jammies, forget it. The next problem was on the day before we left. We were a bit disappointed to come back late at night from a hot, sweaty day at Disney and find that they did not clean our room or provide us with clean towels. The front desk had the security guard bring us fresh towels. When we check out the next day they did give us a $40.00 credit for not having cleaned the room. The last thing we were hit with was a short sales pitch about rebooking the hotel or a Marriott condo resort timeshare for a later date. The offer wasn't bad but I wasn't sure I wanted to return to that hotel, so we did not buy into the package. This Marriott hotel was a far cry from the one we had stayed at in Cocoa Beach just a few nights before. I would have to say I was a bit disappointed, but would still might recommend it to somene who wanted to be as close to SeaWorld as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay every time”
Reviews.Author: 305_Perez_Family
Reviews.Content: A fantastic find especially if you are visiting Sea World! The rooms are spotless and the property still looks brand new. Complimentary breakfast is a huge bonus. Based on their room rates and the amneties, you will not find a better deal in the area. We have stayed here twice now and have booked a third visit later this year. Different story at the Spring Hill Suites on the same property. Their lobby is always loud and chaotic, especially during the complimentary breakfast. Fairfield's is modern and zen-like even at peak times. In summary, great room, parking is free, pool is great, staff is friendly, fantastic breakfast, plus the free bus transportation to Sea World and other attractions, make this an unbeatable value.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel. will go back”
Reviews.Author: rayraysworld
Reviews.Content: We spent three weeks here in October 2010. We had previously stayed at another Fairfield in Canada Drive and as this was almost brand new, we expected a little better than the Canada Drive hotel (which itself is very good). We were not disappointed. The view of Seaworld from our room was awesome and the hotel is clean and professionally run. The included breakfast is pretty good and can be a good money saver. The location was perfect for us and although we didnt use the on-site TGI Fridays, we used the chemist/store every single day. We even had their discount card on our car key fob and saved money every day using it. The staff at the shop were friendly apart from a guy with a ponytail who was like a programmed robot. he did not work in the Orlando way we were used to. There was another minimart nearby and a Wendys and a KFC over the road. and yes its true. KFC do have bigger pieces of chicken over there compared to the paltry/poultry pieces we get served up in the UK. The hotel has a Pizza Hut and various snacks and drinks available poolside. My daughter loved the pool and we used it now n again when we needed a chillout. They have two computers for free use 24 hrs and your card key also fits the adjoining next door hotel and you can use their pcs too or go for breakfast there. We always got a car parking space, the staff were friendly and helpful, our entire holiday was superb and a lot of thanks must go to the part this hotel played in it. We have always stayed somewhere different everytime we have visited Orlando and we would want to again but I think we will stay here again and maybe even become regulars. Absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “would go back, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rayraysworld
Reviews.Content: We spent three weeks here in October 2010. We had previously stayed at another Fairfield in Canada Drive and as this was almost brand new, we expected a little better than the Canada Drive hotel (which itself is very good). We were not disappointed. The view of Seaworld from our room was awesome and the hotel is clean and professionally run. Our room was great too. The included breakfast is pretty good and can be a good money saver. The location was perfect for us and although we didnt use the on-site TGI Fridays, we used the chemist/store every single day. We even had their discount card on our car key fob and saved money every day using it. The staff at the shop were friendly apart from a guy with a ponytail who was like a programmed robot. he did not work in the Orlando way we were used to. There was another minimart nearby and a Wendys and a KFC over the road. and yes its true. KFC do have bigger pieces of chicken over there compared to the paltry/poultry pieces we get served up in the UK. The hotel has a Pizza Hut and various snacks and drinks available poolside. My daughter loved the pool and we used it now n again when we needed a chillout. They have two computers for free use 24 hrs and your card key also fits the adjoining next door hotel and you can use their pcs too or go for breakfast there. We always got a car parking space, the staff were friendly and helpful, our entire holiday was superb and a lot of thanks must go to the part this hotel played in it. We have always stayed somewhere different everytime we have visited Orlando and we would want to again but I think we will stay here again and maybe even become regulars. Absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great price!”
Reviews.Author: laffloud5
Reviews.Content: My husband & I and our 3 girls ages10,6 & 5 stayed here the weekend of July 22,2011. We were very pleased with our stay.We arrived at 1:30 and were checked in right away. I am very picky about where I stay and I must say it was very clean (we usually stay at the (Bonnet Creek also wonderful) however for the price at Fairfield Sea World we could not beat in comparison. Fairfield offered a complimentary breakfast which consisted of cereal,yogurt,waffles, eggs,bagels, juice, coffee etc. Pool is shared with sister hotel but it was not crowded and it has an outdoor bar/grill that offers drinks, pizza hut pizza & dippin dots ice cream. If I had to make a complaint it would be that I had requested a rollaway bed upon my online reservation and asked for one every morning and night and did not get one until our last night. The noise from I-4 was loud but we were not bothered by it and rested just fine once we were asleep. Staff was very nice and helpful(other than not getting the rollaway bed we requested).Beds were comfy & clean(checked for bed bugs upon arrival as I always do & mattresses were very clean looked brand new) there is a microwave and fridge in the room. The fridge kept our food cold but do not turn it all the way up beacuse your items WILL freeze.We were on the second floor so our I pad received wifi w/ no problem(you can also receive it from the lounge area).There is a CVS right in the parking lot along with aTGIF(we did not eat there) Wendy's across the street is open until 3am(we did take advantage of that). We visited Aquatica and bought tickets online w/ dinning pass(lines were not bad) we also purchased the loungers in Roa Rapids area it was totally worth it. We visited the Magic Kingdom we arrived at 9am did all the rides that because we used fast pass(which is a MUST -No waiting in lines) We also visited Wonder Works the kids thought it was great. The T-rex is also a great place for dinner animated dinosaurs and archeological digs for the kids we visit every time we visit, our girls love it) Food is great! then back to the hotel where we had a most comfortable stay : ) When we plan our trip for next year we are planning on staying At the Fairfield Sea World if the prices are still this great.

Reviews.Title: “economy”
Reviews.Author: RAlsulaimani
Reviews.Content: price wise very friendly rooms are nice with fridge and microwave and tv.... staff are ok, not as hard rock hotel orlando.... we have to ask for everything... the splash bar at the pool has a reasonable food but staff are not very helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: stever128
Reviews.Content: We just stayed on a recent trip to Seaworld and Discovery Cove, and I couldn't have asked for a better family hotel. We had six of us, and the room with two queens and a pull out worked perfect. The rooms and the overall hotel was very clean, updated and well kept, and the staff was extremely helpful with positive attitudes. The complimentary breakfast was great, and they had plenty of room to sit. We didn't use the pool, but it looked very clean and nice. They also offer a limited number of early admission and Quick Queue passes for Seaworld and Aquatica, but get to the concierge desk at the Springhill suites next door by 6:45 or you'll be out of luck. Having the Quick Queue passes is worth getting up early. I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Visiting Sea World”
Reviews.Author: GBFortLauderdale
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Sea World and decided to stay at this Fairfield Inn, as we are Marriott Rewards members and this hotel provides early access and free transportation to Sea World, with a few other additional Sea World benefits. The rooms were larger than expected, although to be fair, we were given a handicap accessible room, so I am not sure if all the rooms are set-up similarly. We loved having the little frig in the room to put our toddlers milk and snacks. The hotel serves a pretty good breakfast for free each morning. I was happy to just have my oatmeal and yoguret and my daughter and husband had fun with the waffle machine. It was a good selection. The dining area was nice and my daughter enjoyed the "ocean" theme. Also, the pool area is great for little kids. It has a zero entry section with cute little penguin interactive water fountains. My daughter had a great time. We will be back if visiting Sea World again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: mcaetano70
Reviews.Content: It is not htat easy to go Sea World by walking from this hotel, but the same is true for any other hotel. Anyway, the hotel provides comlimentary trantaportantion to Sea World and Aquatica and also a complimentary quick queue to Sea World which proved to be very useful. Rooms are spacious and good, altough very standard. Complementary breakfast and internet access in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back for sure”
Reviews.Author: kabach1
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute trip for me and the kids to go to Orlando to visit the theme parks. I wanted something closer to Universal however was unable to get two double beds anywhere on short notice. We stayed her in the king suite with a pull out sofa which worked great for 1 adult and two kids. The hotel staff is extremely friendly, smooth check in and check out, nice pool area and very clean. I am planning a return trip next month and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay :)”
Reviews.Author: SayWhatSarah
Reviews.Content: When we pulled up to the hotel we were excited because it looked great. We were exhausted after a long day at SeaWorld, so we were ready to relax by the pool. The staff was great at check-in. The lobby was modern and pretty. The rooms were decent and clean. The continental breakfast was good. But I have to say the pool was our favorite part. The evening was beautiful and we were excited to find out there was an outdoor bar and pizza hut. We didn't want to go out for dinner so we sat in our swim suits and ordered breadsticks, drinks, and pizza and enjoyed the evening swimming afterwards. My daughter adored the splash zone and so did we. I would stay here again if we ever go back to SeaWorld.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Especially great for those who love Seaworld!"”
Reviews.Author: bethscott
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 week stay at this hotel. The hotel rooms are great, but it is worth paying little extra for a bigger suite. Ours overlooked Seaworld, so we could watch the Kraken, Manta and Fireworks from our room. The pool area is smaller than it looks in the photo's, but the hot tub is a brilliant way to end a busy day. We walked to Seaworld once (It is farther than it looks because the entrance is on the opposite side. Best to catch an I-Ride there than walk, if you don't have a car). It is an easy 12 minute walk to Aquatica. There isn't a footpath initially, but the grass verge is wide and easy to walk on. The I-Ride is fine, but there is no way of knowing when it will arrive. Very hot waiting! They should come every 20 minutes. The quick-queues for Seaworld are the best. Book it the day before you want to go to Seaworld. Breakfast at hotel is basic, but free. It is mostly continental style (waffles, muffins, toast, juice, yoghurts, bagels, etc). Great start to the day - but a bit monotonous after a while. There is a McDonalds, Wendy's, and KFC across the road, and a Pizza hut at the pool side. The pizza hut combo meals are about $7.49 each and really nice! . TGI is in front of the hotel - a lovely place to eat. They do a three course special for $12 approx - too much to eat! The CVS on-site is great for basic grocery's and pharmacy. It also has an emergency mini medical clinic should you need one. There is a shuttle bus roughly every hour to Aquatica and Seaworld. It does one other hotel pick-up before dropping you at the parks. A shuttle to Universal leaves hotel at 9.40 and return pick up time is 6pm. You are tied to those times, but it is free. A cab ride one way is about $17 if you use Mears. You can easily catch a cab at Seaworld. The one the hotel organises is $25. Get to the parks early to miss the queues! Or stay until closing. Our average queue time was 15 minutes because we did it this way. Otherwise you could queue for well over 60 minutes for each ride! Have fun! Don't hesitate to book this hotel - it really is great!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Wonderfulworld2009
Reviews.Content: We spend 8 nights at the Fairfield inn last december. We usually stay at 5* hotels but since we were traveling with other family we had to find a hotel that would suit their budget and our "need" to stay in a nice, comfortable place. We stayed at a studio, which I was pleasantly surprised. The studio had a living room with a sofa bed ,plasma TV and a desk. In the room we had a king size bed and a plasma TV. We had plenty of storage space. The bathroom was very simple with hairdryer, some toiletries and very clean. The location was very good, situated in a quiet part of International Dr. , close to supermarkets, malls , walking distance to Sea World and 15, 20 minutes to Disney Parks. T.G.I. Friday is adjacent to the hotel and they deliver to your room. Also supermarkets are very close so we just bought some healthy snacks in the supermarket. The bus stop that takes you all the way "up and down" in International Dr. is right in front of the hotel. Very convenient for those who don't have a car. The breakfast was included and it was basically, eggs (each day in a different style) , yogurt, fruit salad, bagel,toast, cereal, coffee, milk, tea and orange juice. They do have a starbucks coffee counter at the lobby, but honestly it is not a "true" starbucks shop they just have a counter and use the starbucks coffee and charge the same. I tried but it didn't taste the same to me. What I liked the most about this hotel is that comparing to others in the same price range this is by far the best. It is very new and the service surprised me for a 2 1/2* I would recommend to get a room as far as possible from the elevator ( they have the in site laundry next to the elevator) , this is a family hotel so be prepared to hear kids talking really loud and sometimes screaming etc... We don't have kids yet so kids screaming sometimes bother us, and in the room we stayed we didnt hear anything (we got the last room in the end of a long hallway). I would definitely recommend this hotel, specially for families that are on a budget and want to be in nice, comfortable place.

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: Cheshire_Bill
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel Great location Convenient free continental breakfast Free Internet Location perfect for all attractions

Reviews.Title: “excellent suite excellent location”
Reviews.Author: delacourt
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't normally write a review after almost a year but i have looked back and the review i wrote last year was not posted. As it was a year ago all i will say is that we really enjoyed our stay, the hotel is in a great location, we had no reason to complain about anything, we would consider staying here again and i would recommend the hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Things you should have been told.”
Reviews.Author: wicket41
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at this hotel and at a much more expensive resort hotel, and waited until the 'last minute' to cancel one of them. We vacillated between wanting the grandiose resort experience, and saving money, until we finally decided on the Fairfield. Deciding factors were the promise of the QuickQue (like a Fast Pass for the rides at Seaworld) and the convenience of the location; Fairfield is across the street from Seaworld, Discovery Cove, and Aquatica, the 3 parks to which we had purchased tickets, and Orlando traffic is notorious. Things you should know: The Fairfield shares amenities with it's sister hotel, the Springfield Inn. Think of two towers separated by a common pool. The concierge is located at the Springfield. They only have 100 QuickQues for both buildings. If you want a QuickQue, you have to wait in a (sometimes considerable) line at the Springfield Inn in the early morning to request a QuickQue for the next day. On the day we arrived, they had already given out all the available passes. We did get QuickQues for other days, because we arrived at the concierge desk early. They will only give out the passes for the next day, so you have to go each morning to obtain one for the next day. Also, shuttle buses are inconveniently timed. Although they advertise a shuttle to Universal Studios, there is only one AM pick-up (at 9:40, so you arrive well past the park's 9:00 opening to meet the crowds, and one PM take-back shuttle. Shuttles to Seaworld and Aquatica run more frequently, but don't expect Disney bus schedules; these shuttles definitely don't pick up each 15 min. A $4.00-plus-tip 5 minute cab ride is more convenient to get back or forth without the constraints of the shuttle bus. Also, even with the hotel being across the street from the parks, it often takes a 20 min shuttle trip, because the shuttle stops to pick up guests from other hotels. The pool was much nicer than expected; some websites erroneously show a picture of a plain, rectangular pool listed under this hotel's address. The picture is really of a different Springfield Inn in Orlando, not the one listed at Seaworld. The poolside grill does not open until 3:00 pm on weekdays, and it is slow service, but the entire atmosphere, with the palm trees, tropical music pumped from the speakers, and the sound of the fountain's running water from the water features/kid's zone, is lovely and relaxing. On our trip, the pool never appeared to become overcrowded - maybe everyone was at the parks, considering the pool is shared by both the Fairfield and the Springfield Inns. Although we asked for 'early check-in', our room was not ready until normal check-in time at 3:00 pm. But check-out time was a fabulous 12 noon! Rooms were clean and bright, and the queen beds were much appreciated when we considered that the more expensive hotels were providing double beds. However, the windows faced the parking lot, and we could hear the trucks rumble in the street and noisy people coming into the hotel from their cars. The morning complimentary breakfast was a true money saver. Don't come past 8:15 or you may not get a table; it gets quite busy in the eating lounge. They had 2 waffle irons to make your own waffles, but the wait could be 10 minutes. We usually opted for the pre-made scrambled egg disks (one morning was hard-boiled eggs, very strange morning fare), a meat (sausage or ham), oatmeal or cold cereal. There was also fruit, yogurt, bagels and bread to toast, juice and coffee. Very nice. A CVS across the parking lot supplied us with very convenient staples; a mini-fridge in the room kept the beverages cold. The TGI Fridays also in the parking lot was convenient and excellent. Staff was friendly and helpful in a limited capacity; don't expect a full-service hotel that will awe you when you walk in. Do expect a newer, clean, convenient, smaller hotel well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant. Already looking to book again!”
Reviews.Author: CarlGalvin
Reviews.Content: Just back from a fabulous 2 week stay, The hotel is brilliant, the staff friendly, rooms clean and spacious. A big thank you to The Breakfast crew of Joe, Robert and Ashley your help, tips and advice were appreciated and my two young girls loved there baby Shamus. The pool crew were also great especially Adnan. This hotel is an ideal base for family's wanting to visit Orlando and as a hidden treat you get complimentary Quick queue tickets for Seaworld and a regular bus to Seaworld and Aquatica. The reception and pool area has free WI-FI, the breakfast is fantastic and the poolside menu is great for tea and snacks after the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...!”
Reviews.Author: simonc22
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 10 night stay at this hotel and it was absolutely fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff, they were great, in particular Sebastien in the breakfast hall! The rooms were very clean and comfortable and with enough space for all luggage, etc. The free breakfast is basic, but does the job - bagels, muffins, waffles, juice, etc. For those that want a free breakfast there are places nearby to visit. The location is ideal for those who wish to visit the theme parks, especially Seaworld, Discovery Cove and Aquatica. We'll definitely be returning to this hotel, I would recommend it to anyone looking for a comfy and enjoyable stay in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Sea World Perks Are Misleading...”
Reviews.Author: AXO1010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my children, and another couple with their children so we could enjoy the pool in the afternoon and use our annual passes to go to Sea World that night. I generally stay at other hotels in the area, but I was drawn to this hotel b/c the promise of perks to guests going to Sea World like "Quick Queue" passes, transportation back and forth, etc, etc... We checked into the hotel around 2PM and mentioned we'd be going to Sea World that night with our annual passes as we dont like to take the small children in the heat of the day. Fast forward to 4:30 ish when we were ready to head over to the park... we went to the concierge desk to find out it closes in the early afternoon. (The concierge desk is where you get quick queue cards, arrange for special tours, etc, etc...) We then asked if someone from the front desk could help, we were told "no" b/c their concierge is run by Expedia and they have no access to it. They were rude about it, and very "not our fault, blame Expedia"... but I had to point out to them that they were CHOOSING to have Expedia run their concierge. I just think having a concierge desk close in the afternoon is crazy... especially in Orlando where folks spend their nights at theme parks, restaurants, looking for things to do, etc, etc... (Isnt the purpose of a concierge desk to help people looking for information / things to do?) When I told the "Manager on Duty" that the primary reason we came to this hotel was for the "Quick Queue" passes the hotel promises their guests, he told me that they only have a few to give out each day, and they go first thing in the morning anyway. (Like that was supposed to make me feel better!) All in all, it is a plain hotel. Not great, not bad... to me it was the Sea World perks that made me choose there, and now that I know they aren't really legit, I'll choose elsewhere next time. Oh - and PS - never could get the "free" internet to work.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: drbutchie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there while on a quick family/ business trip. Hotel was clean and well maintained and the staff was friendly. The king room I had was small and the bed slightly uncomfotable. Theis hotel shares a relatively small pool area with its sister hotel Spring Hill suites so the pool and hot tub are always very crowded. The breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A great value next to SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: meab
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly based on price and other reviews on trip advisor. The big pluses for this particular hotel were: -close to SeaWorld and Aquatica -free QuickQueue passes for SeaWorld -free breakfast -pool looked fun -free parking, as well as free transportation to the parks The lobby was very nice, a little more "hip" than what I expected from a Fairfield Inn! The hotel shares certain things with the SpringHill Suites next door, and when I was over there, it was a little swankier than the Fairfield, but both were nice. The hotel is very close to the parks. We were able to see Kraken and the SkyTower from our room. There is a TGI Fridays and CVS right outside the hotel, which was very convenient. Park transportation was ok. In the morning, the bus was right on schedule and it was easy to use. However, there were only set times for return, so you had to plan accordingly. The hotel pool was nice, and all the kids in our party enjoyed it (ages 10, 7, 3, and 1). The zero-entry feature was nice, and it's hard for kids to resist the various spray features. There was also enough room in the pool to hang out and relax away from the spraying and kids :) Breakfast was good. There are two waffle makers (regular and chocolate waffles), bagels, yogurt, toast, fruit, oatmeal, muffins, cereals, orange and apple juice, milk, coffee, tea, etc. There were a few other hot items - one morning was eggs and breakfast potatoes, the other morning was ham and eggs. The eggs were just these circular disks that I didn't try, because it didn't look very appetizing, and there were plenty of other choices anyways. Staff was very friendly and helpful. At breakfast, there was a staff member making balloon animals and such for all the kids. Our kids got a real kick out of that! A great feature was the Quick Queue passes for SeaWorld. However, on the morning we were visiting, there was a computer glitch, which caused us to wait on line for quite a while (30+ minutes), and we ended up having to leave our info and return to get the passes. Then, once you are in SeaWorld, you have to go to another window to turn the passes in to get the actual bracelets. It's a bit of legwork to skip the lines, but worth it to bypass the lines for a few main attractions. Not sure if I would pay for those passes separately, but it's easy enough to stay at a nearby hotel to get them. Overall, we felt the hotel was a good value, and would definitely recommend it to others planning a trip to SeaWorld!

Reviews.Title: “Next year agin!”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang_Frankfurt
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is very close to major attractions in Orlando. It is one of the official Seaworld hotels and located at the International Drive you can reach major shopping malls and the Convention Center in few minutes. Almost next door is a convenient store and TGI's for dining. The rooms are spacious and clean and contains everything that you need. At the lobby you find the Marriott "Market" which will provide you with basic drinks and foods. But the CVS next door has evreything you need. The hotel has reacted very flexible to our needs and were a group of total 35 people. It is owned by the same property management as the Spring Hills Suites (next building). We will definitely try to stay in this hotel next year again!

Reviews.Title: “very good for families”
Reviews.Author: bellaGrandCayman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and found it perfect for somebody not driving. Caught bus up and down I-Drive, ate at TGIF and Denny's nearby, and it was very handy to have CVS Pharmacy adjacent. Staff at the nextdoor hotel part (where the gym is situated) were very friendly and informative about what to see and do, and the breakfast staff were lovely. They were friendly, hard-working and very attentive, much better than people working at many other hotels I've stayed at. The desk staff where I stayed were less helpful but it was easy to just walk next door to the other hotel part next to Starbucks, and ask there instead. The rooms were clean and the beds were divine. It was very helpful to have a microwave and fridge in the room too. I wish more hotels did. The breakfast was basic - more cereals than cooked stuff but Denny's and other places are within walking distance. The gym also was great! New equipment and well maintained. If I return to this area I'd happily stay here again. My only criticism: only having 24 hour free internet in the hotel room. I think it should extend for the length of the time the room is booked for. Otherwise, very good hotel for price and great, well-serviced location. Customer service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Timber9762
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Fairfield for a full week and I think the consensus among my entire family (teens included) was that this was one awesome hotel! I considered location, price, and continental breakfast features when booking this hotel, as well as what it looked like online, and was not disappointed in any area. When we booked in late Monday night, the room was not what had been pictured online, and when I called the front desk to inquire, they said it was a slightly different room that I had booked online, but that the one I wanted was in fact available, and for only $3 more per night. We took it and were extremely happy the entire week! The staff was very helpful and made us feel welcomed (especially Joe in the breakfast room), and the cleaning services were top notch and practical. We would most definitely stay there again if we are fortunate enough to return to Florida! Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: jaika
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, room large enough from 2 adults and 3 children [7, 3, 1] and the endless amounts of stuff we bought, good breakfast choice, lovely staff especially at the starbucks] clean pool. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and are hoping to go back in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel. We would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: PeterW99
Reviews.Content: Although we have previously stayed on International Drive on four previous occasions (including the Wyndam Orlando) I would say that this hotel is better than most. It has a modern interior, is spotlessly clean, and has comfortable bedrooms. It is just at the back of Seaworld. The Red Line I-Trolley stops outside (stop 35) about every twenty minutes. Being towards the end of the drive you can generally always get a seat. The hotel provides a complementary buffet breakfast, with a variety of dishes, serving between 6.30 - 9.30 a.m. every day. The pool itself was smaller than we expected, but again spotlessly clean and beds, towels were always available. The is a CVS store outside the hotel, along with a variety of places to eat within easy walking distance. If/when we return to Orlando we would certainly want to stay in the this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay, I know I Will Return”
Reviews.Author: pogoaddict4life
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriot Gold member who travels quite a bit and stays in the Orlando area quite often. I have stayed in the general area of this hotel 4 times this month and out of the other stays this month, this has been by far the best hotel. The hotel is very clean.
