The furniture and decor is very moden from the lobby to the guest rooms. The room smelled clean and fresh and looked clean and fresh.Bathroom is a good size. I had a King Suite which has a mini fridge and microwave as well as a seperate sitting area with desk, couch, chair and flat screen tv. The bed was comfortable and had another flat screen tv in that area. The pool area was nice. A great place for families with young kids to have fun in. A game room and a nice pool side reasturant as well with quick service. The hotel offers a small free breakfast in the mornings with your basics. Juice, coffee, yogurt, breads, fruits, waffles etc. Nothing special but it does the job and being free will save you money. The hotel desk staff was very friendly and very helpful. When I asked for suggestions on where to eat with a 5 year old they printed out a list of places that were offering "kids eat free" options for that evening. Other times when I needed some thing I was helped quickly and with a smile. I only have 2 small complaints about the hotel is that the free internet is wired so your stuck at the desk to do work on your laptop unless you stretch the cord as far as you can to maybe sit on the couch in an uncomfortable manner. In a hotel as moden as this and as nice as this they should go the extra mile and get wireless internet in the rooms so that people can sit where they want in their rooms to get their work done. Also their little shop downstairs with drinks etc is way to high on their prices. A little frozen meal that costs $1.98 at Walmart was over $5.00 downstairs. Every thing was over priced. Do yourself a favor and don't buy from their shop, go over to CVS which is right there. More expensive then walmart but still far cheaper then the hotel.If it weren't for the internet and shop prices, I would give this hotel a huge A+. Despite these two issues I will return in the future. I will just bring my own wireless internet next time through verizon or some thing, as well as bring my snacks and drinks ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome. Wish I was staying longer than 1 night”
Reviews.Author: tonycash72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our flight back to Philly from Orlando. We had a great four days in Clearwater for spring training baseball and this hotel was a great finisher for our vacation. Got there around 2 Pm and the room wasn't ready but they offered the same style room on a different floor that was ready. Room was clean, good sized and modern looking. The Lobby area is very nice and modern as well. The pool area is great, large pool with a kids area. Hot tub was nice as well. They had an outdoor food counter where you could order basics, like burgers and pizza. It's Orlando so kid's are everywhere, just have to time out your pool usage to the best time of day to avoid too many kids. I was in the pool from 2:30 to 4:00 with only a small group of kids. Later at night after 8 was much more crowded. Close to attractions and restaurants. CVS right next door. Breakfast selection was average, but free. Will definitely stay here my next time in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Somerset-jim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the fairfield inn for 12 nights with my family and it really lived up to the high rating in trip adviser. The hotel is about half way between Disney and Universal with a very good TGI Fridays and a CVS 24 hour store next door. There are more restaurants near by and the I Tram bus passes the hotel which is nicely set back from the main road. There is a quiet pool area with a pool bar and a starbucks coffee lounge. Internet access in the business centre is free The rooms are modern and clean, well maintained and have microwave and fridges. The family room is a good size and easily suitable for a family with two children. The hotel has a laundry which could allow you to take fewer clothes and give more room for all the purchases from the premier outlets - clothes and shoes are excellent value. The breakfast is relaxed and the helpers friendly. You do get a bit fed up with the same breakfast choices but that would be true in any budget hotel. The hotel caters for businessmen and convention goers as well as families on holiday. The premium shopping outlets are at either end of international drive and have similar shops but for the real bargain hunters with a car try the outlets at Kissmee - a bit more run down but perhaps better bargains. We hired a car and you really do need one to get around. The alamo car hire rep makes every effort to get you to upgarde to a bigger car but the bottom of the range "compact" car was plenty big enough for 4/5. Parking at both disney and universal costs about $15 per day (there is a bus from the hotel but its $8 each and you are limited to the return times) - although if you go to disney after about 6 pm parking is free. We found that a late arrival at the park on a day when it was open until midnight was a great way to do the rides without the ques. Kennedy space centre is a great day out and an easy drive from orlando. We had great time, the hotel was as good as we had hoped and its location was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Nerd8903
Reviews.Content: This was such a last minute planned adventure since we wanted to use our Seaworld discount coupons for Spring Break. What a wonderful surprise. From the moment we walked in we had the BEST time, BEST room, BEST front desk experience. We got there late, ordered pizza from the pool side cafe while we waited, we toured and enjoyed the pool area. It seems like everyone who stayed there this past weekend felt just like I did....satisfied and pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Great, location, value, ammenities, and pool.”
Reviews.Author: inhoclupo
Reviews.Content: This was a Great hotel we stayed at for three nights while we visited Seaworld and Discovery Cove with are two small children. The hotel is new and very modern and is located with less than (cab ride) 5 minutes of both parks we vistied. They provide free transportation to Seaworld but a cab ride will cost about $5.00 dollars to each of these parks. They provide a nice breakfast with juices, cereal, toast, muffins, ham, coffee, and waffles. Their was always a place to sit and the servers were very helpful and friendly. The pool was mainly designed for kids, but was very nice with a full bar and a Pizza Hut. The hotel shares the pool with another Marriott hotel but the pool was never croweded. The rooms were very modern and contemporary look, and the beds were very comfortable. They also have a TGIF restaruant and a CVS pharmacy within 1 minute walking distance which is a plus. We will use this hotel again if we ever visit this area again. Great Bargain.....

Reviews.Title: “Clean as a whistle”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler21nj
Reviews.Content: Very Very Clean - you could eat off floors. New beautiful rooms , Nice breakfast and pool. Great Hotel for the money. Good Location . Friendly staff. I normally stay at a much fancier style hotel and was really very pleased . I would go back in minute.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: jgsmunich
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights. service was good, got an upgrade to a suite. not large, but 3 beds.. rooms were clean. complained about dirty sofa mattress ans it was replaced. suite had two flat screens and and an ihome for the ipod. typical breakfast, bagels, yoghurt, eggs, and make your own waffle station. this wasnt great, but free. nice pool with hot tub. great location. 2 minutes from discovery cove, seaworld and aquatica. 15 minutes from airport, universal, and maybe 20 from disney. cvs pharmacy and a fridays in same parking lot basically. fridays serves food at the bar til 1 a.m. free wireless, and a snack shop as well. had a great stay. i drive is out the door to the right, so access to many restaurants etc. 5 to 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Best Fairfield Inn....ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bcnya440
Reviews.Content: As longstanding Marriott rewards member, I've stayed in my fair share of Marriott-branded hotels. This Fairfield Inn (FFI), was by far the best; it is on par with a Springhill Suites or even a regular Marriott. For those that aren't aware, the FFI is Marriott's entry-level brand. At this location the hotel was clean, bright, and the service was exceptional. The free breakfast was fresh and hot, and the staff running the breakfast bar was very friendly and helpful...A+. Forgot to mention that the pool was very nice and kid-friendly as well. There was also a pool-side bar and splash zone. From now on, I know where I'm staying whenever I come to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Toby074
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days Dec 28th through Jan 5th. Very friendly and informative front desk staff, indeed all staff said hello each time you met. Pool area was lovely and well light up at night. Wired internet in room and wireless in lobby free. Breakfast was fine tho limited but as it was free this was not a problem. Nice room and a great location. The only minor complaint was that the Splash bar at the bpool was nearly always closed and for 4 days there was no coffee available in the lobby. This is minor but overall this is a great hotel for an Orlando trip

Reviews.Title: “great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: hazlee
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 weeks over christmas and new year, it was very well equipped with free internet and free travel to sea world. travel to WDW abd universal was $8 each, free breakfast was a great bonus and the room was spacious. The cleaning was not up to my standard but we did have beds made and fresh towels each day. Trolley stop 35 outside with CVS and TGI in the carpark.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: maple1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for ISSA Convention...got a great deal on rates. Watch for specials. Hotel was new, beautiful pool. Close to Sea World, Disney, a short drive to convention center. Rooms were very clean. Only had one minor issue, the maid service did not attend to our room to late afternoon. Mentioned at desk and was no longer an issue. Breakfast is somewhat boring after 5 or 6 days, however, there are restaurants all around the hotel. Beds were ok but have had better at similar Mariott properties. If you want an stove for cooking check out the Residence Inn attached next door. TGIF will deliver to the hotel. Always had cold water and snacks out at front desk....nice touch

Reviews.Title: “Another great Marriott along Intl Drive - right by Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: Marriott_Devotee
Reviews.Content: We go to Disney regularly (14+ visits in the last 10 years), and while we stay on-property often, we are, well devoted, to Marriott properties as well. Orlando/Lake Buena Vista has plenty of them. We've stayed in the Marriott "Village" a few times, on Canada Dr. thrice, and in the Courtyard in the Vista Center as well. We thought this new property right by SeaWorld would be a nice compromise location in case we decided to visit Universal. . And, yes, the location is great. Turned out we only went to WDWorld, and because of the proximity to the Central Florida Pkwy exit on I-4 and Exit 67 - Epcot Centre Drive, back and forth between hotel and theme park parking lot was almost always 10~15 mins. That's a lot faster than Disney transportation. . While the combined property (the Fairfield Inn/Suites is combined with a Springhill Suites) has a semi-themed pool, that I thought would be some fun, we never used it since it was so cold when we visited. The grounds were quite nice and the proximity of a 24-hr CVS, a Wendy's, a Friday's and a Chevron and a strip mall, made the location quite convenient. . The room we had was wonderful - a real suite with a King bed and a pull-out Queen couch. Two tv's, a decent-sized fridge and a microwave! Bathroom was typical Marriott - clean and well-maintained, with a great shower. My only complaint was that the hearing/cooling system blasted to get the room to the right temperature, then got quiet for 3~10 mins, then blasted again. . (Free) breakfast was run very well. The hordes would descend every am at 7:45 ~ 8:15 and the workers worked like heck to keep up with us (I gave them a few $$'s in tips). While only a "continental" breakfast (i.e., no meats, omelets or full fruit buffet), the waffles, yoghurt, juices, breads, and eggs toffered were very tasty and well presented. Another example of a Marriott delivering more than what might be expected at another hotel. . Could have walked to Seaworld, but we didn't. Still, the location, the property and the staff (who worked hard to deliver great hospitality), make this another Marriott I would be happy to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fair...No Wow moment”
Reviews.Author: GundamToronto
Reviews.Content: To some attractions, shuttle bus only dropping off passengers to another bus. Definitely not shuttle bus. Not good idea when u re travelling with elders or kids. Shuttle bus schedule very limited. You have to tell the driver what time you will be back prior. Room is dark, table lamp only available when you asked for it. Complimentary breakfast food only have cold boiled eggs and other simple food. Strong chlorine smell when you went into the room. Wifi only available in the lobby. Maybe it is slightly cheaper but I rather pay a little more with far less restrictions

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jgieske347
Reviews.Content: we were treated with a smile, the pool was clean and nice, starbucks gal friendly and slept well, what better? got it on hotels,com for $79 nice stay they were very nice to our 3 year old grandson

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Bububear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on the tail end of a 3-city vacation. Conveniently located on International Drive, just across from SeaWorld. Short drive north to convention center, various restaurants, Wet N Wild and premium outlet shopping. Short drive south to another huge premium outlet mall on Vineland. Was too tired to do SeaWorld, so we did outlet shopping. I understand that Disney WOrld and Universal Studios are also a short distance away. Hotel itself was very clean and nicely furnished. Staff very friendly. Breakfast was so-so: no breakfast meats and egg patty (?) on the day I was there. Good selection of breads, cereal and a waffle station. Loved the convenience of self-service laundry (coin-operated). Fairly secure property. Pool was nice. CVS pharmacy and TGI Friday's within short walking distance (TGIFriday is also the source of room service food). KFC and Wendy's across the highway. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: JM11traveler
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites at Seaworld for the weekend. The staff that checked me in were wonderful and very accomadating. My room was on the second floor and next to the elevator but it had no noise which was great. The room looked fine when we were there the first night and everything looked in new condition. The fridges they have in the room are great and they chill fast!! The next day when we arrived from the park, we saw a few bugs in the room and we headed to the FD and they switched us to another room on the 5th floor which was better. I live in Florida so I did not make a big deal about the bugs in the room like most people would. The breakfast at the hotel was great, they offered egg patties, home fries and pancakes. It was great to start the morning. They also had a nice pool area which was really nice. Overall it was a great hotel and I do recommend it if your in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay with 2 young kids..”
Reviews.Author: fitandfab432
Reviews.Content: This trip was last minute...got a week off unexpectedly and decided to take the kids (1 and 3) to disney for an early Halloween treat. My stay was perfect.....Our room was on the main floor, which may have bothered some but was perfect for me because it was a short walk to the car and a short walk to breakfast. The room was clean and the bathroom was spacious( possibly a handicapped accessible room). The breakfast was enough to satisfy me although there were no breakfast meats.... They had varied yogurt, bagels, bread, muffins, tropical fruit, hard boiled eggs or scrambled depending on the day; cereal, orange, apple juice and coffee and milk and they had a make your own waffle stand. I had the oatmeal with raisins and cinnamon and did just fine. What i really appreciated was the refrigerator and microwave in the room...it's a necessity with small children. The pool was very kid friendly and they had a blast... CVS and TGIF are within walking distance. I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and attention to detail by hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: cookie039
Reviews.Content: Public areas, pool area and room were great. Have never stayed in a hotel where all the staff was so centered on providing an outstanding guest experience. The best was when I was eating breakfast and Kim came over to our table and asked if I'd like to have my orange sliced. Now that's attention to detail!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay if visiting SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: DianeV80
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week - had absolutely no problems. Staff was exceptional - friendly and efficient. Had a room with a King size bed - clean and very comfortable. The breakfast provided was your standard fare -- bagels, cereal, oatmeal, waffles, eggs, yogurt, juice, milk, coffee, various fruits and muffins. For a bit of a difference - go and eat at the adjoining Springhill Suites (your key gives you access to both properties) - which also has mini cinnamon strudels and cut fruit. If you want waffles, I'd advise going early so you don't have to wait. Only a 5 minute walk to Discovery Cove - sidewalks available. Not as convenient to walk to SeaWorld as there are no sidewalks down International Drive. But the trolley service picks you up/drops you off right in front of the hotel -- at a cost of only $1.25 each way or you can buy a pass for $10 for the week. Trolley usually comes every 15-20 minutes. CVS pharmacy and TGIFridays are conveniently located in front of the hotel. Also have food/drinks available at the Splash Lounge located by the pool (have daily specials and the pizza hut options were consistently good.) The pool was great - no one there in the afternoon and was able to sit in a chair in the zero depth section and read.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: clau_sissa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the first week of September and it was a great experience! The rooms are clean and nice! The staff is great! And there is complimentary breaksfast, internet and parking! Which makes a perfect combo! The location is very close to Sea World and Aquatica but a little far from the heart of International Drive where are restaurants, stores and gift stores. It is a very good location for those who want a quiet place to stay but that is not too far away from the fun! Totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Grandma & Grandson”
Reviews.Author: Acree
Reviews.Content: Me & my 6 yr old grandson stayed here for 5 nights & absolutely loved it. So close to Sea World, Aquaticia & Discovery Cove, the only parks we were planning on going to. He loved the pool! The staff was nothing but nice! I would stay here again & again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean new hotel..Gym was excellent...Suites are nice but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: sun2fun20
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a month after grand opening..FronCheck in was a bit rot desk person..nicely gave me complimentary upgrade to suite...but he assigned me key to another guest's room..I heard voices inside room before I tried key..so I avoided the uncomfortable "caught mistakenly trying to get in someone elses room with the wrong key scenario"...Back down to front desk..he apologized..but then gave me another key that did not work..back down..a bit embarrassing for him...but third time was the charm.... Bed was comfy...suite is nice but a little cramped in bed area..Bed was comfortable..but not much space on either side....Nice to have two flat screens in room ..but very annoying thing..when you use one remote..signal will bounce and activate other TV in living area...So watching TV before bed..click off TV in bed area..and on pops TV in living area..Not sure this is still issue..but in such a small suite..you might need two different TV's to avoid this remote usage problem.. A/C unit was dampening carpet..two repair guys try to storm in the door which luckily I had security latch on..di not knock first..very rude... Micro and fridge were nice....bathroom had plentiful hot water and good pressure Breakfast was okay..not the best of Fairfields for breakfast and remember this is close to Sea World...kids are everywhere..and breakfast area is chaotic with families.. Gym was a great refuge..overlooking pool area..excellent cardio equipment with their own TV screens...the best part of my stay was working out in a quiet gym... Pool was nice with jacuuzi and a little bar with food was adjacent...nice for families I would recommend this hotel but the Springhill next door may be a better choice..

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jammin11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to Seaworld and Aquatica and the front desk people were friendly and very helpful. Our room was large and quiet, and we could see Seaworld from our window. The kids loved the pool area, although I would encourage the staff to clean the pool more often during times of heavy use. The concierge at the adjoining hotel was helpful by offering up discounts on theme park tickets, although we ended up not using his services (we had to leave early). Breakfast was OK, although typical heavy use of styrofoam was worrisome. There was a shuttle trolley that officially came every 20 minutes to and from Seaworld which we used, but lost some precious time waiting for it to arrive both ways (especially the late night trolley at closing time...understandably a crunch period, but waiting over 1/2 hour with cranky, tired kids wasn't fun). All in all, a great place for people who might like to avoid the crazyness in other parts of town, but still be within close range. The hotel also offered a nice Seaworld package deal.

Reviews.Title: “Only missing one thing...”
Reviews.Author: MrsMitchelli
Reviews.Content: The only thing missing from our room was a full length mirror. Otherwise the room was wonderfully new and clean. The bathroom was very large and clean as well. We stayed here as part of a large group for my brother's wedding at Discovery Cove. We had requested rooms together, but were spread out between three floors. The staff was very accomodating allowing us to have a "Pizza Party" in the breakfast area one night. They went so far as to recommend Flipper's Pizza. A Wonderful Recommendation! The pool area was great for our 4 year old son and the many other children staying in the hotel. The location was very convienient to the Wedding location and SeaWorld for the day after the wedding. Also, in the same parking lot of the hotel was a CVS (bought bottled water and snacks) and a TGIFridays. We ate there twice even though we do not enjoy the one close to home. If we were to do SeaWorld or Discovery Cove again (which I do not see in our future) we would stay at this location again. But only if we again received the low online rate of $59.99 a night.

Reviews.Title: “I Woud stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Vouso
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for a room with two queen beds. As they didn't have any available at the moment of my checking in, the front desk gave me one with two king beds for the same price. I am very grateful for that.The hotel is new, with happy colors, clean, quiet, there is a mini market inside, just in case you need detergent, snacks and other small things one might need in the last moment, etc...I woul definetely recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my family to relax and enjoy Seaworld!”
Reviews.Author: jimmyjeans
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Orlando for our summer vacation. We found the perfect place next to seaworld. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and the guest desk employees gave my wife several "insider" tips for the theme parks which we took full advantage. You will not find a more clean and beautiful place. The hotel has room service and free internet which the kids used every moment while in the room. Splash pool restaurant bar was great to relax after our theme park adventures.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: Colo01
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth. Room was on the third floor overlooking Central Florida Parkway and parking lot as well as the KFC across the street. (Not much to look at) But not at the hotel much anyway so this was OK. Room was clean and in good shape. Bathroom was cleaned and in good shape. Went to Universal Studio's the first night, Returned about 11:30 pm ready for bed. Found that the hotel was full of South America tour groups. Could hear doors opening and closing, talking till about 1:00 AM. Bring some Tylenol PM. If you want to enjoy breakfast go after the tour groups leave. Breakfast was only served till 9:30 AM. If you are from the West coast or Rocky Mountain area. That's early (6:30 am - 7:30 am) I found that breakfast was just OK. Frozen eggs and potatoes Just your basic stuff. Nothing to write home about. I did go to the outdoor bar on the last night food was good beer was cold. They could use some more seating and help in the bar/pool area. Not a bad hotel if you plan on being gone and only using the room to sleep and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with stay”
Reviews.Author: soonermom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here after getting a great deal on a package from Marriott Vacation Club. It was extremely convenient to Sea World, Discovery Cove, and the freeway. The room was very clean, modern, and large. She really enjoyed eating room service from Pizza Hut Express and enjoyed the cute pool. (It is small, but she lucked out and had it all to herself.) The complimentary breakfast had lots of choices, and there were several restaurants nearby. I would recommend this for families with young children looking for a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain”
Reviews.Author: lisalashes7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Monarch and paid Â£172 for 4 nights. We turned up a day early hoping to get in but was told by reception they were fully booked - receptionists were not that helpful! So we stayed at the florida hotel and conference center for one night - don't go there, too expensive for one night! So the next day we returned to the Fairfield Inn to check in on our correct date. This hotel is new and decorated so nice! Our room slept 4 people so we had a seperate sofa area and had 2 flat screen tv's. Such a nice room and bathroom - was really happy with my choice of hotel. Aquatica is next door but don't bother going there, i think they had one dolphin that you can't even see! Seaworld is across the road and is great!

Reviews.Title: “A great find in the perfect location.....”
Reviews.Author: CKBM
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews in Trip Advisor and we were impressed. Firstly we got an upgrade to a suite which was great as we really used the fridge. Plus it's great to have a large room. The beds were very comfy and very quiet at night even though the hotel was very full. The bathroom is of good size with bath and shower and plenty of space to store things. The pool area is great especially for children with the splash area. The food and drink at the pool bar is very reasonably priced. Locally there are a few restaurants. We did have a car which proved very useful as we were able to get to Disney in 15 to 20 mins door to door ! Wal-Mart is very near for any necessities and of course for driving to the outlet malls (Premium Outlets is a mere 5 min drive from the hotel) and Florida mall. We also drove to Clearwater and Honeymoon Island (absolutely gorgeous). What we found was staying at this quieter end of I Drive is that it is easier to get to places as the I-4 is easier to get to than other places on I-Drive. In fact, getting to Disney and back was as quick staying here than using Disney transport when we have stayed in Disney properties in the past. The hotel staff were very friendly and the room was always cleaned very well. You also get a good view of Seaworld fireworks at night and the brilliant Aquatica water park is a 10 minute walk away (though we drove there - only $12 to park) as we had a 'stroller' and there aren't pavements all the way. The included breakfast was adequate as there was always something that the children would eat which is great. Having to go out each day for breakfast is a pain especially when you want an early start at the parks, so this is a good thing at this hotel. There are laundry facilities on most floors (only $1 for wash or dry) and free internet access in the business area. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fab!!”
Reviews.Author: jackieCumbriaEngland
Reviews.Content: just returned from Fairfield after 12nights with my 11 year old son. Read up on reviews on tripadvisor before travelled, the hotel is fab. Everything is modern and new, we where upgraded free to a suite on the 4th floor. 2flat screen tv's,fridge,microwave,seating area,2 queen beds which where so comfortable! and best of all a view of seaworld and the fireworks every night..brilliant The staff where very helpfull, we did not have a car but there is a i-ride stop right outside the hotel. We went all over on this and used the shuttle bus to go to Universal and Busch Gardens, small charge of $8 each return, which I thought was very good. Lovely pool shared with the Springhill suites, you can get food and drink there made fresh at reasonable price. Across the car park is TGI fridays which is very popular with locals and tourists, we visited couple of times, food was fab,and service great, not overpriced. All in all a brilliant holiday and would recommend to anyone who wants a nice hotel not in the centre of international drive but within easy reach of the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Bluesprings12
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, very clean, staff very helpful even when you don't check in until 12.15am! The room we had was a suite with 2 Queen beds, fridge, microwave etc, not a great size but no problem. Only thing to watch out for is the complimentary breakfast - get down early because when it's gone it's gone!! I would recommend this hotel & hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT CHOICE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: japonte
Reviews.Content: Jackeline Herrera was the best at the front desk! She was really helpfull. The hotel have everythig you need when travel with kids, beautiful pool and so funny, beautiful and comfortable rooms, laundry, gym..... etc. If you want a wonderful stay dont hesitate to make a reservartion in this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AT FAIRFIELD”
Reviews.Author: mbernardi84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn and Suites Seaworld on march as a honeymooner. The hotel is great, clean rooms, helpful staff and fair prices. I have nothing to complaint about it. I have even lost my car on the parking lot and the staff helped me to find it.

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it - terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Jules1804
Reviews.Content: After checking on Trip Advisor this hotel came up 2nd in Florida. I requested early check in when I booked and we phoned THREE times on our journey to the hotel to ask for an early check in. We got to the hotel and a very rude receptionist told us they didn not honor requests and had no record of ours, we showed them the confirmation with the request on it and she just said NO. I find it hard to beleive that a hotel this sixe did not have ONR single room ready. So we walked across the courtyyard to Sprinfield and they went out of their way to help us. I know they are both run by Marrior but they are miles apart in srevice. This receptionist should be fired and if there had been any management in evidence I would have taken this further. But we had a delivghtful stay at Springfield

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: jules7706
Reviews.Content: Stayed her during a week's break in Orlando. Was a little concerned about location as it's not that near the main strip in Orlando - but soon got used to the trolley bus and got a taxi a couple of other times. Was really impressed with the room decor and having two double beds, felt very luxurious, bathroom was nice too, it really was a great room. Breakfast wasn't all that great - lots of bread and cereal but never felt full up after breakfast - my friend wasn't fond of the polysterene plates and cups, not great for the environment. Tour desk staff were helpful in booking trips, reception staff were friendly. Only had one gripe - when we booked in first, our room was near an electric generator outside and I found the noise annoying - we were able to move rooms though and no fuss was made about it. Didn't use the pool but it looked lovely. For a comfortable stay with a bit of peace and quiet, this is the place. Also very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A good Fairfield Inn”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights over a weekend in-between conferences at a rate of $79 +tax per night in mid February. This is a large Fairfield which shares facilities with a Spinghill Suites (again a Marriott brand). This sharing allows them to have better facilities than a stand alone hotel. The pool is outside with a spa bath and a pleasant area with poolside bar which does snacks and drinks. The gym is well appointed for a Fairfield inn and is actually in the Springhill suites overlooking the pool. The Fairfield has a games/arcade room for kids. The hotel is a standard Fairfield in terms of appointment and rooms. Everything was fine, the free internet worked and was high speed, the gym kit was in good condition and the free breakfast the standard fare of bagels, etc. On the Sunday morning I was late to breakfast and the coffee and other stuff had run out. The breakfast lounge is large and spacious. Staff all friendly and professional. The location (overlooking SeaWorld) is good with multiple eating outlets a short walk away and a TGI Fridaysâ€™ across thee parking lot. There is a CVS Pharmacy being built next to TGI. A good stay and Iâ€™d happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: metoocka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our two young children (under age 4) stayed here for 2 nights in late January, 2010. The lobby looks great and check in was very fast. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was a decent size and the decor was modern and fresh. Everything was clean and the 2 Queen beds were comfortable. The free Continental breakfast was fun. In addition to the usual high carb offering found at most free breakfasts (such as cereals, oatmeal, breads, donuts, etc.) there was also some protein to be found in the form of hard-boiled eggs and a variety of brand-name yogurts. The Starbucks is in the lobby of the adjacent hotel on the other side of the pool. That's also where to go to purchase Seaworld tickets. The concierge there totally hooked us up with WAAAAY better priced tickets than I'd seen anywhere else. A free shuttle takes you to the parks and picks you up. The only minor complaint is that the vent fan in the bathroom didn't work. But we would definitely use this hotel again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good value"”
Reviews.Author: slakboy21
Reviews.Content: Nifty new hotel. Everything's in great shape, pool is nice. Staff is friendly. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Large Clean rooms in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: sweetT13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night to visit Seaworld and couldn't be happier. The hotel has only been open 8 mos and is sooo nice and clean. Very modern "spa like" atmosphere in lobby and rooms are wonderful. Lots of space, nice bathrooms and quick elevator service. Laundry room on our floor (6) was handy. One word of advice: don't go out to the pool/bar area without your key card! Breakfast was good-waffle maker, cereal, bagels, yougurts... Starbucks on premises but never found it! Must be at the pool bar??? You can see Sea World roller coasters from parking lot. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Best Sleep Ever!”
Reviews.Author: brybread
Reviews.Content: ROOMS: Lovely for a 2 star hotel-Very surprised at the furnishings which was a burst of colour. Had the best bed in the world and a bzillion pillows! No joke, every night, the minute I pop my head on to the pillow I fall asleep LIKE THAT! It's THAT amazing that I am now purchasing a new bed back home that has to be that comfy! Huge flat screen TV. Other standard ammenities inc. Coffee machine and hair dryer, Free Wi Fi and lots of towels that are replaced every single day. LOCATION: Great! Opposite TGI Fridays; walking distances to a super market, a pharmacy, KFC, McDonald's... Directly outside of the hotel is a stop for the I-ride Trolley that goes up and down International Drive with regular stops to the many attractions on International Drive including Prime Outlets. So therefore, even though we did not have a car, we still got around pretty easily W/O having to waste any money on taxis because of this trolley. CLEANLINESS: Room was cleaned everyday-although there were days when I felt that it was at a minimal standard, suffiecent but not great, AND for some reason, maybe its the humidity in Orlando; but I felt that my bedsheets were a bit moist each night? It was like that for the whole trip... Overall SERVICE, AND HOTEL AMBIENCE is great! Loved it, it was casual enough for two 19 year olds to feel safe and relaxed on our first holiday to the USA. Receptionist were very lovely who would help you with anything. They even let me use THEIR spare computer when the FREE computers for guests were taken. Loved it, but since Orlando has so many hotels, I would consider trying some place else, however I do highly recommend it to anyone. Only NEGATIVE : No room safe!!! However you are able to store your valuables in personal safes in the reception desks-it is annoying to keep going down to the desk to retrieve and store your things though. Unlike other Orlando Hotels, Fairfield Inn @ Seaworld is simply a typical hotel. No extras like kitchen, fridge, stove, kettle. Washing machine is included on each floor though.

Reviews.Title: “New and close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer856
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and were very pleased with the experience. We were not going to Sea World, but it is just across the street. The hotel is very new and nicely decorated. Large breakfast area with lots of tables. There is a TGI Fridays just across the parking lot in front of the hotel, and KFC and Wendy's across the street. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially the girl at the front desk. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay, nothing wrong but nothing extrodinary”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: We checked in, got our rooms, rooms were clean, bed were comfortable... are you starting to yawn yet? and they had a continental breakfast in the morning. It was obvious this hotel is sticking to the bare minimal of Marriott Standards. The continental breakfast has two concentrated juices, one type of bagel, and two types of mini muffins. The breakfast selection was limited at the breakfast. Also my nephew went back to the breakfast bar to get another Yogurt and the attendant locked the mini frig and told him, "It is 9:02 am, breakfast is over" and he walked away. Sheets and towels were the bare minimum too. Housekeeping left barely enough towels each day and never left new soap or shampoo. The hotel was ok. The property is beautiful but it needs a little more spit and shine.

Reviews.Title: “What a find- A truely awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: James_Liz_Mog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 10 nights.The hotel was spotlessly clean, really helpful staff, beautiful pool, and the complimentary breakfast was a welcome extra. I seriously can't praise this hotel enough. Directly outside the hotel is a T G I Fridays which also provides the room service for the hotel, opposite the hotel there is Dennys, Wendys, KFC and McDonalds. So there is plenty of choice for food or you can easily use the I-Ride service to venture further up I Drive. Unlike most people it seems we decided not to hire a car for our holiday in Orlando and relied on the public transport system. The hotel is on the I-Ride trolley route (stop 35) that runs the full length of international drive, trolleys run approximately every 20 minutes a 14 day ticket for the service only cost $17 for unlimited travel. We also used the Lynx bus service to get to Disney. You could catch the Lynx 50 from outside Seaworld direct to Magic Kingdom Ticket and Transportation Centre for only $2 each way the journey takes less than 30 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming, friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Paula053
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Orlando for 16 years and this was one of the best hotels we've stayed at. We stayed for 18 nights and this new hotel was centrally located for Orlando International Airport, Convention Centre, shopping, Sea World etc.. The staff were very friendly and helpful, always checking back with us, if we had requested anything, that we actually got it. The rooms were very contemporary, clean and comfortable but a fridge would have been useful. We will definitely go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay when visiting Sea World!”
Reviews.Author: Beachdreamers4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Fairfield Inn and Suites in July when they were offering a phenomenal package rate for tickets to Sea World & accomodations. We arrived very early at the hotel and while a room was not available, the front desk staff gladly gave us the tickets that came with our package and a plush Shamu (each) for our 2 kids. When we came back later in the afternoon, our room was ready and was clean, spacious, and comfortable. It was a brand new hotel and had a new carpet & paint smell that was, at times, overwhelming, but that was our only complaint. Breakfast the next morning was really good! We marvelled at how well the staff kept everything stocked and replenished. My daughter took the last orange, and in a few seconds, a gentleman was there adding more to the basket. The same was true when my husband took the last cup of coffee! The pool area was great for small kids. My kids were there for over an hour. We went early in the morning and there were no towels--despite us asking several times at the front desk for some to be delivered. I imagine the pool area gets crowded as it is shared with the Spring Hill Suites next door. A great stay, close to Sea World. This will be our first choice if we return to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: msjagmd
Reviews.Content: I would give this Hotel an excellent review. From the moment we called for directions from I-4 to the moment we checked in, I have no complaints. My husband and I were in Orlando for a quick trip-Fly in Saturday and out on Sunday and decided to stay at the Fairfield Inn because of it's location to the Airport and honestly for the price. For $ 45 a night we couldn't complain, because the hotel was clean, the room was clean and the pool was clean. I have to also say, that their front desk clerk was very helpful and accomodating because at check in, I inquired if the rooms had a refridgerator. We were informed that our room did not but if I needed something stored that he would happily do so in the main refridgerator of the hotel. Given that I am currently nursing, and did not have my daughter with me and needed to pump, it was nice to know that they would have accomodated me. My husband and I have decided that if we need to go back again we'll definitely stay here again especially if we come back with our little one.

Reviews.Title: “Fully recommended!”
Reviews.Author: etroconi
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Orlando to visit the parks, or in business plan, I think this place is perfect for everything. Even though you're right in front of Sea World, you're also only 10 minutes away from Convention Center and 15 from Downtown Disney. The place is beautiful, elegant, the rooms are very comfortable even if you're alone or in family plan. Excellent price for such a nice place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lindakn
Reviews.Content: We booked this one night stay a month early. We were a little nervous to have done this after seeing the reviews, but it was a great stay. We checked in at 10 P.M. The staff was very friendly. Our room was clean and fully stocked with towels. ( It cost $59.) It had a king bed, and a 32 in. flat screen TV, which my husband loved. The mattress was comfortable. The breakfast was all you could ask for with make-your-own- waffles and a large assortment of other things. There was fruit, different yogurts, cereal, bagels, donuts, and very good coffee. The best part was we could see the fireworks at Seaworld from our window when we checked in. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk!”
Reviews.Author: Corley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in July 2009 and had multiple problems: 1. One of two booked rooms wasn't ready by 6pm when I checked in 2. Room had faulty lighting which was _never_ fixed during my stay 3. Housekeeping failed to clean room first day and was late in cleaning on day 2 4. I had items stolen from my room -- *** NOT A PLEASANT EXPERIENCE On the plus side, the staff were very friendly and the hotel amenities rated about 8/10. The pool was very nice and it did have internet in the room (NO WiFi though). Note: There is no safe in the room nor at the front desk. There are no security cameras anywhere on property, either. The management tried to address items 1-3 by giving me half off one room for one day, which was really just a token gesture if you think about it. Most importantly, though, was the theft. I had two small bags of electronics (hand-held gaming systems) and a laptop stolen from the room on the day I checked out. My family and I went to the pool and we took most of our items but my sons accidentally left their belongings in one of the rooms. The room was locked and a hotel staffer entered the room about two hours after I left. The entry by the staffer was expected since I had checked out; however, upon finding my stuff in the room the staffer should have contacted the front desk and had them taken from the room. Instead, he took the electronics (and left the other bag untouched) and then just locked the room. When I figured out that my sons had left their belongings in the room about 3pm, I returned to the room and then discovered that the items were stolen. It was a traumatic experience for my pre-teen sons. Of course, I spoke with the hotel management, who were very concerned, but that's about it. They filed a report with Marriott, which led to a claim being filed at the corporate level. I also had the police come by and I submitted a report. In the following weeks, Marriott Claims said that they weren't liable for the theft since there was no proof of anything (that I had the items and that they were at fault). It wasn't until the police made an arrest and I wrote a letter to Marriott Corporate that they re-opened the case and subsequently compensated me for the loss. All told, the hotel should have recognized their fault up front and at least made an effort to compensate me. It's horrible that I lost $1300 worth of items and it took over a month and an arrest for them to give me anything. I would have been happy with a hotel credit for the lost amount so I could use it at another Marriott hotel. Instead, I had to go on the offensive to receive compensation. I love the Marriott properties and will stay at another Marriott, but this particular hotel is now on my "do not stay here" list, despite its proximity to Seaworld and the rates. I expected more from a Marriott and this place just doesn't meet those standards. -R

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Orlando at Seaworld
HotelInfo.Address: 10815 International Drive, Orlando, FL 32821
